results.title: The General Assembly
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films, V.R. Sarma and Krishna Singh
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the United Nations General Assembly and describes its efforts to promote human welfare and peace among the peoples of the world. Surveys the organisation of the General Assembly, areas of jurisdiction, and the work of committees. Includes scenes of an annual session as delegates and visitors arrive. Narrated by Michael Rennie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United Nations Films, V.R. Sarma and Krishna Singh

results.title: The General [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Boorman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the true life exploits of Irish gangster Martin Cahill (Brendan Gleeson) who pulled off a series of daring robberies in the eighties, earning him the nickname, The General. John Boorman’s offbeat black and white biographical film (lensed by cinematographer Seamus Deasey), chronical’s Cahill’s blatent criminal reign and his eventual downfall, via an over-ambitious art heist. Boorman mines rich material from this unlikely hero who apart from having a very unorthodox relationship with two sisters (Angeline Ball, Maria Doyle Kennedy), became a folk hero in Dublin because of his open contempt for authority and his ongoing battle with the Irish police force. Gleeson’s performance is aptly understated, choosing to portray Cahill as an enigmatic figure forever concealing his face. Jon Voight as the frustrated police inspector obsessively in pursuit of Cahill makes a fine and sympathetic adversary. Cast also includes Adrian Dunbar and Sean McGinley. (Awards: John Boorman- Best Director 1998 Cannes Film festival)

results.title: The General
results.creator_credit: Joseph Schenck, Buster Keaton Productions, Buster Keaton and Clyde Bruckman
results.brief_description:
Keaton, an engine driver, recaptures his train and rescues his girl after it has been stolen and she has been kidnapped by Union soldiers from behind Confederate lines. Based on an actual incident in the Civil War this is widely regarded as Keaton’s finest film. Oblivious to the dictates of normal comprehension, Keaton as Johnny its own.

Credits: Producer, Joseph M. Schenck ; directors, Buster Keaton, Clyde Bruckmann ; writers, Al Boasberg, Charles Smith ; photography, J. Devereaux Jennings, Bert Haines ; piano accompaniment, William Perry.
Cast: Buster Keaton, Marion Mack, Glen Cavander.

results.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
results.creator_credit: Antony Jay, Peter Robinson and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
John Cleese narrates the first of a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis. Concentrates on the suppression of zero, and the change of scale in graphs. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Gay rock and roll years
results.creator_credit: Clare Beavan, Shauna Brown, BBC and Fulcrum
results.brief_description: A history of the anglo-saxon gay and lesbian movement scored to the liberating popular tunes of the last 25 years. Moving from the initial struggle for gay law reform, to the revolutionary politics spurned by Stonewall to the homophobic policies initiated under Thatcher and the New Right, this film is a celebration of the achievements and struggles of gay and lesbian activists. Funny, inspiring and bound to get your feet tapping “The Gay Rock and Roll Years” is a great introduction to queer history. Songs featured include Doris Day singing “Secret Love”, The Kinks doing “Lola”, Sylvester singing “You Make Me feel (Mighty Real) and Culture Club asking “Do You Really Want To Hurt Me?”. From rockabilly to soul to glam to disco to punk to house: we’re gay, we’re proud, we don’t ever stop the dance.

results.title: The gay men's guide to safer sex (E)
results.creator_credit: James MacKay, Terrence Higgins Trust, Basilisk Productions and David Lewis
results.brief_description: A documentary produced by gay men for gay men offering information on HIV and AIDS and exploring the boundaries and possibilities of safe consensual sex. Using a straightforward presentation sexual information is offered in an unintimidating manner. Includes information on using condoms effectively, how to have safe oral sex and how to avoid transmission of blood and semen in S/M sex play. WARNING: CONTAINS EXPLICIT SEXUAL MATERIAL.

results.title: The Gathering flame [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: The sea has a certain fascination for Australians. Although it is a large dry contitnent, most Australians live close to the sea. This film makes magnificent use of the sea as a background to the work of designing, building and servicing the variety of navigational aids off the coast of Australia, particularly the work of the ships of Cape Pillar, Cape Morton and Cape Don. An interesting split screen effect has been employed in this fast moving colourful documenatry. Commentary by John Laws.

results.title: The Gathering drum
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
At the beginning of the kindergarten day children are encouraged to move freely and choose from a variety of play objects. A drumbeat then brings them together to be introduced to the day’s activities.

results.title: The Gathering
results.creator_credit: Harry R Sherman, Hanna-Barbera Productions and Randal Kleiser
results.brief_description: This feature length film made for television is a Christmas story with a difference. Adam Thornton (Ed Asner) walked out on his family years ago to focus his energies on his business career, leaving a wife and four children - two sons and two daughters. Thornton is a gruff, hard-headed man who finds out just before Christmas that he has a terminal illness and only a few weeks to live. On telling his estranged wife, Kate (Maureen Stapleton), it is agreed that a family reunion should take place over Christmas, but only on the proviso that his imminent death is not disclosed to his now four adult children. The story avoids a “sugary-sweet” tone by exploring the interaction between Thornton and each of his family members as he attempts to tentatively reconcile the past. He soon discovers that not everyone is totally forgiving but it is his wife who is the anchor, who holds the family together. Ed Asner and Maureen Stapleton are excellent in their roles and are accompanied by a very able support cast including Sarah Cunningham, Bruce Davison, Veronica Hamel, Gregory Harrison, Lawrence Pressman, John Randolph, Gail Strickland, Stephanie Zimbalist. (Awards: Emmy for Outstanding Special - Drama or Comedy, 1978)

results.title: The Gas turbine
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Peter De Normanville
results.brief_description: The gas turbine is a heat engine, the simplest and smoothest running yet devised. All heat engines burn fuel, change a small part of the heat produced into energy, and waste the rest through the exhaust. In the gas turbine, rushing torrent of hot high-pressure exhaust gas is the turbine’s source of power.
